page.title: 10Hitchmead School.
page.content: Hitchmead School officially opened on the 16th of November 1970. Hitchmead is a special middle school, it deals with children who have problems with reading and writing. There were originally 54 pupils and 7 staff, today there are 102 pupils and 14 staff. It has 10 classes and three houses: orange; black; white. The pupils range in age from 5 to 16 years. There is no official school uniform, but the school colours are green, orange, grey and white. No jeans or boots are allowed. They have lessons of Maths and English, but not foreign languages. They do not have a set timetable in the junior and middle stages of the school. The senior stage of the school is however timetabled.
